intro: Capraria montevidensis var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the pinnatifid capraria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and parts of Argentina. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
